question: Question_09
statement:
Let \emph{W} be the subspace of $\displaystyle \mathbb{R}^{3}$ spanned
by $\begin{bmatrix} -1 \\ 1 \\ 1 \end{bmatrix}$ and
$\begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 2 \\ 3 \end{bmatrix}$. Find the vector in \emph{W}
which is closest to $v = \begin{bmatrix} -1 \\ 1 \\ 1 \end{bmatrix}$.
sols:
We can make a matrix out of the vectors that span W $A = \begin{bmatrix}-1 &1 \\ 
1& 2\\ 
1&3 
\end{bmatrix}$ $rref(A)= \begin{bmatrix}
1 &0 \\ 
0&1 \\ 
0&0 
\end{bmatrix}$ therefore the columns of A are linearly independent and
we can compute the projection matrix P using the equation

$P = A(A'A)^{-1}A'$

$(A'A)=\begin{bmatrix}-1&1&1\\1&2&3\end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}-1&1\\1&2\\1&3 \end{bmatrix}=\begin{bmatrix} 3&4\\4&14\end{bmatrix}$

$(A'A)^{-1}=\frac{1}{3*14-4*4}\begin{bmatrix}14&-4\\-4&3\end{bmatrix}=\begin{bmatrix}7/13&-2/13\\-2/13&3/26\end{bmatrix}$

$P = \begin{bmatrix}-1&1\\1&2\\1&3\end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}7/13&-2/13\\-2/13&3/26\end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}-1&1&1\\1&2&3\end{bmatrix}
=\begin{bmatrix}-9/13&7/26\\3/13&1/13\\1/13&5/26\end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}-1&1&1\\1&2&3\end{bmatrix}$

$P=\begin{bmatrix}25/26&-2/13&3/26\\-2/13&5/13&6/13\\3/26&6/13&17/26\end{bmatrix}$
The vector in W closest to the vector v can be found by taking the
projection of $\underline{b}=\begin{bmatrix}1\\1\\1\end{bmatrix}$
$P\begin{bmatrix}1\\1\\1\end{bmatrix}=\begin{bmatrix}12/13\\9/13\\16/13\end{bmatrix}$
